title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 November 2013 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu1> has quit  
02:15 <Denis> has quit  
04:24 <huhongbo> has joined #xwiki  
04:24 <huhongbo> has quit  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
04:52 <ekarlso> has quit  
04:54 <ekarlso> has joined #xwiki  
06:01 <Denis> has quit  
06:01 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:14 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
06:19 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
06:39 <Denis1> has quit  
06:58 <cjd> xD  
07:36 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:43 <cjd> has quit  
08:26 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <mflorea> Good morning. FYI I'm debugging the misc test failures.  
08:45 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:49 <vmassol> mflorea: me too :)  
08:49 <vmassol> (good morning)  
08:58 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:15 <mflorea> vmassol: same thing, the URL to style.css is http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/skin/skins/colibri/style.css;jsessionid=hzdnearqpqqu1alf2v4zk8zml and skinURL.getPath() returns /xwiki/bin/skin/skins/colibri/style.css;jsessionid=hzdnearqpqqu1alf2v4zk8zml which cannot be found and thus style.css remains empty.  
09:15 <mflorea> jsessionid in the URL breaks the export  
09:17 <camil7> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <mflorea> XWikiServletURLFactory#normalizeURL(String, XWikiContext) does it.  
09:22 <mflorea> input: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/skin/skins/colibri/style.css  
09:22 <mflorea> output: http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/skin/skins/colibri/style.css;jsessionid=1v8wct16bsj9h1k981brzahd8v  
09:22 <mflorea> by context.getResponse().encodeURL(url)  
09:23 <vmassol> ok thanks, are you fixing it, I can do it if you prefer  
09:23 <vmassol> ?  
09:23 <mflorea> I don't know how to fix it :)  
09:23 <mflorea> so go ahead  
09:23 <vmassol> ok doing it  
09:32 <vmassol> mflorea: I'm worried that we may get a lot of issues with code that doesn't handle query string param or url fragments  
09:32 <mflorea> well, I don't any qs or doc fragment in that URL  
09:33 <mflorea> I don't see ..  
09:33 <vmassol> I mean ;aaa=bbbb  
09:33 <vmassol> how is this called?  
09:33 <mflorea> nothing  
09:33 <mflorea> qs is after ? and doc fragment after #  
09:33 <vmassol> it's not part of the url spec?  
09:33 <mflorea> that is nothing, it's simply part of the URL  
09:33 <mflorea> nop, I don't think it is  
09:34 <vmassol> in any case skinAction.render() would fail similarly if there were fragments or qs  
09:34 <mflorea> it's just something that java servlets understand  
09:34 <andrewmcveigh|wo> has quit  
09:34 <mflorea> yes, that is true, but it should only discard ?.. and #... not ;..  
09:35 <mflorea> we could strip ;.., I doubt we'll have any use case when ;.. is really part of the URL  
09:36 <andrewmcveigh|wo> has joined #xwiki  
09:37 <mflorea> You could have a space or page name containing ;, but it should be URL encoded in this case, while ;jsessionid is not  
09:38 <vmassol> we could decide to not support clients without cookies too  
09:38 <vmassol> lots of people are doing this  
09:38 <vmassol> having jsessionid is also bad for SEO  
09:39 <mflorea> tmortagne: there are 12 webstandards validation tests failing on the syntax page but I'm not sure what excludes to add (I've seen you added some already).  
09:39 <vmassol> (for ex: http://java.dzone.com/articles/java-jsessionid-harmful )  
09:39 <tmortagne> mflorea: yes I know  
09:39 <tmortagne> I fixed the other but there is is no such thing as exclude for these  
09:39 <tmortagne> I need to add the feature  
09:40 <tmortagne> basically validating those pages does not make much sense since they are not used as pages  
09:40 <vmassol> sending an email  
09:42 <camil7> mflorea:validation tests failures - probably my fault, maybe I should look into it  
09:43 <mflorea> camil7: tmortagne is looking, you should check with him  
09:43 <camil7> where are the failures? I get a bit lost on ci.xwiki.org ?  
09:43 <mflorea> just a sec  
09:43 <mflorea> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-webstandards/2859/testReport/  
09:44 <tmortagne> camil7: I will take care of it, XHTML validator does not like to much having duplicated ids on some subpages  
09:44 <tmortagne> but it's normal since there is duplicated content between 2.0 and 2.1 at least  
09:44 <camil7> ah, and I /thought/ I fixed that :-/  
09:44 <tmortagne> either we find a way to fix those id related error or we exclude those pages from validation  
09:45 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
09:45 <tmortagne> but excluding these require to refactor a bit the validator  
09:45 <camil7> ah, its these example headlines ... I must have done something stupid when trying to run the tests so I did not notice them  
09:45 <tmortagne> so if you have an idea to fix those validations issue without a hack be my guest ;)  
09:46 <camil7> but these headlines also have been present in the previous version ... why did this not fail there ?  
09:46 <camil7> ah, maybe because it has been only one table for all examples ....  
09:47 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
09:47 <tmortagne> there was only one result  
09:47 <tmortagne> now the is several results  
09:47 <tmortagne> (in each section)  
09:48 <vmassol> mflorea: just sent an email  
09:48 <mflorea> ok  
09:49 <vmassol> I can strip it but more places will arise where we need to do this and we're starting to do the stripping in a lot of places  
09:49 <vmassol> so we need to decide if we really want to do that  
09:50 <mflorea> I'm fine with dropping support for jsessionid (no cookies)  
09:52 <vmassol> if you guys can answer quickly then I can decide how to fix it and fix it quickly  
09:52 <camil7> maybe it would be easier to implement XRENDERING-20  instead of wrestling the webstandard tests into not noticing some violations  
09:54 <tmortagne> camil7: the id is not generated by the toc macro  
09:54 <tmortagne> you always have an id with a heading  
09:54 <tmortagne> it's generated by xwiki/2.x syntax parser itself  
09:54 <camil7> ah, yes, this test checks the generated html, of course, so it would not help to scrap the syntax there  
09:55 <tmortagne> only thing I can think of is having difference example for each syntax  
09:55 <tmortagne> so that a difference id is generated  
09:55 <camil7> yes, mayeb that would be the simplest fix  
09:56 <tmortagne> but then there is consistency  
09:56 <tmortagne> but I guess it's minor enough as difference between syntaxes to be ok  
09:57 <camil7> actually what does XWiki do if it has two identical headlines in one document? I guess it adds numbers to make the id unique ?  
09:57 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <camil7> anyway, yes, slightly modifying the headlines in the examples is maybe just the simples solution  
09:59 <camil7> sorry for not finding it beforehand, I remember I locally modified the test runs to only check the XWiki.XWikiSyntax page to make them "run faster" (otherwise would not even have finished over night on my small box at home ...), so I missed that glitch  
10:02 <tmortagne> camil7: nop XWiki does not do anything right now, or we would not have the validation failures ;)  
10:02 <vmassol> sdumitriu: are you here?  
10:02 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:02 <vmassol> ok I'll go ahead and hope sdumitriu agrees  
10:09 <vmassol> mflorea: now I wonder if I should remove the places where I added the stripping or not ;)  
10:09 <mflorea> :)  
10:09 <vmassol> (we could leave them as safeguards or remove them for cleanliness since they shouldn't be needed)  
10:14 <ekarlso> are the debian packaging files stored anywhere ? :)  
10:21 <j-simard> has quit  
10:21 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <j-simard> has quit  
10:22 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
10:22 <j-simard> has quit  
10:24 <camil7> tmortagne: I see there are even more failures in some other subpages ( e.g. XWikiSyntaxTables), :-/ I will try to rewrite them; but if not, maybe the tests can just exclude them ? (I guess the WCAG tests already exclude the main syntax page the hard way, anyway)  
10:25 <j-simard> has joined #xwiki  
10:31 <ekarlso> Anyone got a answer to that ?  
10:31 <ekarlso> Looking to package up a java app and wanna use xwiki bits as a base possibly  
10:31 <cjd> you might find something usable on maven.xwiki.org  
10:32 <cjd> that's where content is posted to by the build bot and during release  
10:32 <cjd> http://maven.xwiki.org/releases/org/xwiki/enterprise/  
10:32 <cjd> somewhere in there :)  
10:33 <tmortagne> ekarlso: they are deployed as maven artifact, search "debian" in the link provided by cjd  
10:34 <tmortagne> the debian repository is "generated" by scanning the maven repository in a cron  
10:38 <vmassol> mflorea: FTR it's called a path parameter: http://doriantaylor.com/policy/http-url-path-parameter-syntax  
10:39 <vmassol> spec: http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3.3  
10:39 <vmassol> I was remembering it because I handled it in the new URL modue  
10:39 <vmassol> modue  
10:39 <vmassol> module  
10:40 <vmassol>      \* Extract segments between "/" characters in the passed path. Also remove any path parameters (i.e. content  
10:40 <vmassol>      \* after ";" in a path segment; for ex ";jsessionid=...") since we don't want to have these params in the  
10:40 <vmassol>      \* segments we return and act on (otherwise we would get them in document names for example).  
10:45 <camil7> tmortagne: I can just scrub that HTML from the examples in  XWikiSyntaxHeadings and replace by the proper XWiki syntax, as we have no {{toc}} on that page any longer  
10:46 <tmortagne> camil7: the issue is not with the toc  
10:46 <tmortagne> and it should be with html either  
10:46 <camil7> but then the ids for the headins are unique, as xwiki generates  
10:46 <camil7> generates them  
10:47 <mflorea> has quit  
10:47 <tmortagne> camil7: you mean you were putting the heading result in a html macro ?  
10:48 <camil7> no, I just scrapped the {{html}} marco that used to show the results  
10:48 <camil7> which was used to hide them from the {{toc}} - which is no longer there on the XWikiSyntax  
10:49 <tmortagne> camil7: ok I see  
10:51 <camil7> I still get lots of failures from the WACG, of course, but not from the XHTML Validatior  
10:51 <camil7> I think I send another pull request, if that is ok - after updating the translations, too :-/  
10:52 <tmortagne> camil7: you should not get any failing from WCAG anymore  
10:52 <tmortagne> I excluded all of them  
10:52 <tmortagne> maybe you did not pulled XE  
10:52 <camil7> ah, ok, so I should just pull  
10:52 <camil7> yes, I forgot ... doing so now  
11:14 <mrflibble> has quit  
11:18 <j-simard> has left #xwiki  
11:18 <evalica> has quit  
11:20 <tmortagne> camil7: applied, thanks  
11:20 <camil7> tmortagne: thanks, too, I hope the tests make it now  
11:21 <mrflibble> has joined #xwiki  
11:26 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:40 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
13:08 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:33 <vmassol> guys, any known issue for the release or we're just waiting for the CI to build everything?  
14:33 <gdelhumeau> It's ok from my POV  
14:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: working on a bug in confluence parser but not a blocker for M2  
14:40 <vmassol> tmortagne: ok  
14:40 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I'll try to rebuild everything to test wiki creation  
14:53 <evalica> has quit  
14:53 <vmassol> fails to build platform  
14:53 <vmassol> tmortagne: [INFO] XWiki Platform - Wiki Stream - Instance - Oldcore . FAILURE [5.367s]  
14:53 <vmassol> ah  
14:53 <vmassol> i need to build rendering I think  
14:53 <vmassol> right?  
14:54 <vmassol> I saw you modified the syntax factory  
14:55 <tmortagne> I did not modified the syntax factory, I modified the syntax converter  
14:55 <vmassol> yes ok that's what I meant  
14:55 <tmortagne> I will look at it, jenkins seems to fail  
14:55 <tmortagne> but maybe it built too quickly  
14:55 <tmortagne> I tough I had built the project before committing  
14:57 <vmassol> wow org.xwiki.rendering.internal.docbook.DocBookCompatibilityTest is really really slow on my machine, I'll need to check what it does  
14:58 <vmassol> also we have a lot of  
14:58 <vmassol> Warning:  org.apache.xerces.parsers.SAXParser: Property 'http://www.oracle.com/xml/jaxp/properties/entityExpansionLimit' is not recognized.  
14:58 <vmassol> I need to check that too  
14:59 <cjd> XML expansion limit is to prevent http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Billion\_laughs  
14:59 <cjd> and it looks like xerces doesn't accept it and is impossible to make not vulnerable :)  
15:00 <vmassol> tmortagne: same problem after I rebuild rendering, must be genuine  
15:01 <tmortagne> I'm on it  
16:31 <andrewmcveigh|wo> has quit  
16:40 <mflorea> has quit  
16:43 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I've just rebuild and tested wiki cration and it generates errors  
16:43 <vmassol> \*creation  
16:43 <vmassol> I used the defaults  
16:43 <gdelhumeau> errors?  
16:44 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/7486393/raw/cee5083e8be562092ce2d1a16bbf4fd756383557/gistfile1.txt  
16:47 <gdelhumeau> I see, let me fix that  
16:49 <vmassol> make sure you or someone does a test pass before we release because there might be other issues  
16:49 <vmassol> upgrade tests would be nice too  
16:56 <gdelhumeau> I'm working on it  
16:57 <vmassol> I can help with testing  
16:57 <vmassol> but  
16:57 <gdelhumeau> when did you see this message?  
16:57 <vmassol> I fear that with this bug I cannot do more tests without risking that the test be not conclusive  
16:57 <vmassol> the UI was ok  
16:57 <vmassol> the message was in the console  
16:57 <vmassol> let me retest to see exactly when it appears  
16:58 <vmassol> ok  
16:58 <vmassol> it appears when I clicked on "cancel" in the DW  
16:58 <vmassol> \*appeared  
16:59 <gdelhumeau> this PR shoudl fix it  
17:00 <vmassol> hmm  
17:00 <vmassol> I wasn't trying to delete a wiki  
17:00 <vmassol> your PR seems to be about that  
17:00 <gdelhumeau> no  
17:01 <gdelhumeau> in the menuview.vm, there is a call to canDeleteWiki()  
17:01 <vmassol> ok  
17:01 <gdelhumeau> which was wrongly checking if the current page had the programming rights  
17:02 <vmassol> BTW useful doesn't take 2 "l" at the end ;)  
17:02 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you should not use checkAccess if you just want to know if something is possible  
17:03 <tmortagne> there is hasAccess for it  
17:04 <tmortagne> checkAccess is more a kind of assert and if it fail it always produces a log to indicate that someone went somewhere it should not have (like the UI let it passed etc.)  
17:04 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: still fails  
17:04 <vmassol> did you retest?  
17:05 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/7486780/raw/2b9382ca1ec85b28ca1486ab8b2ff190115d4cc0/gistfile1.txt  
17:05 <vmassol> I rebuilt wiki-script and replaced the jar  
17:05 <vmassol> is that correct?  
17:07 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: basically in canDeleteWiki you should use hasAccess and in delete you should use checkAccess  
17:08 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: are you sure, the log shows WikiManagerScriptService.java:192 which is not WikiManagerScriptService.canDeleteWiki() anymore  
17:09 <vmassol> hmm you're right  
17:09 <vmassol> I pulled and copied  
17:09 <vmassol> but forgot to build  
17:09 <vmassol> :)  
17:09 <vmassol> retesting  
17:10 <vmassol> works  
17:10 <vmassol> :)  
17:10 <vmassol> continuing my tests  
17:11 <gdelhumeau> :)  
17:13 <vmassol> btw we have 2 deprecation usages in XWiki.Distribution , not sure what this page is  
17:13 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/7486914/raw/03a8c37bc62c547c306e683f58ebfe4ff31ba196/gistfile1.txt  
17:16 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: in the wiki LT, there's "edit" but you click on it you don't get into edit mode. You're in view mode. Shouldn't it be "View Descriptor" instead?  
17:16 <vmassol> (Wiki LT = wiki index)  
17:16 <gdelhumeau> sure, it can be an improvment  
17:17 <vmassol> another improvement:  
17:17 <vmassol> if you create a wiki but cancel the DW  
17:17 <vmassol> then you try to join it from the main wiki with a standard user  
17:18 <vmassol> you'll see https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/e51dc4f0-5848-41b7-981a-1e1bbbd952f9/07af3b0f97cf113dd8a8c1ce2db35a2b  
17:18 <vmassol> because the page doesn't exist  
17:18 <vmassol> maybe join should only be possible if that page exist?  
17:19 <vmassol> hmm if I say yes it says I have joined successfully though  
17:19 <vmassol> ah my bad  
17:19 <vmassol> I misread  
17:19 <vmassol> the page is just the webhome of the wiki which doesn't exist  
17:21 <vmassol> OTOH we have a bug when creating pages from another wiki I think since the URL I get is http://localhost:8080/xwiki/wiki/test/create/Main/WebHome?parent=WikiManager.JoinWiki  and the parent is missing the wiki name…  
17:23 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: delete failed  
17:24 <vmassol> UI says it's ok but I have this in the console:  
17:24 <vmassol> https://gist.github.com/vmassol/7487165/raw/78df1f58464338462ed6b94c6d539f9dddbfc87a/gistfile1.txt  
17:25 <vmassol> (which incidentally shows that the UI doesn't correctly report a failure)  
17:25 <gdelhumeau> I think the wiki is deleted  
17:26 <gdelhumeau> but there is a problem with the descriptor  
17:27 <vmassol> when I deleted my test5 I only got: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/7487218/raw/4454909c60ac1b7f0166569ccc5546edbc5d2f12/gistfile1.txt  
17:28 <vmassol> test1 was created before you fixed the previous issue in case it has an impact  
17:28 <vmassol> it shouldn't  
17:29 <vmassol> Another bug: in the descriptor page I see:  
17:29 <vmassol> "If enabled, all this wiki's generated externals URLs will starting with ~~https~~."  
17:29 <vmassol> the ~~ seem wrong  
17:30 <vmassol> (this form needs some improvement to follow our form best practices too)  
17:31 <vmassol> (normally it's "title", "description", "input" an we have some class that we use)  
17:31 <vmassol> BTW created descriptors are also missing parents  
17:31 <vmassol> (they're orphaned)  
17:31 <vmassol> another problem: the descirptor page says "Last modified by Unknown User on 2013/11/15 17:10"  
17:32 <vmassol> I created it when I was logged under "Admin"  
17:32 <vmassol> (this means the user is null)  
17:33 <sburjan> has quit  
17:39 <vmassol> (fyi this is an example of a form using our classes: https://gist.github.com/vmassol/7487372 )  
17:41 <vmassol> I also think the title is not correct: instead of XWikiServerTest4 it should be:      Wiki: "test4" (and the level 1 title should be removed from the sheet)  
17:42 <cjd> did you see my easter egg? ;)  
17:45 <vmassol> cjd: yep  
17:45 <vmassol> :)  
17:46 <cjd> It's not easy to make easter eggs anymore since the change which makes content not execute in a page  
17:46 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I thought new wiki AS was supposed to be empty?  
17:46 <vmassol> It's full for me  
17:46 <vmassol> (using the DW)  
17:47 <gdelhumeau> yes it was in M1  
17:47 <vmassol> btw top active members has a bug  
17:47 <gdelhumeau> now I need to add a BeginFoldEvent in DW for RC1  
17:47 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/8651a5f1-8da8-4d8c-8156-8af5960a594a/56b74170ba18a3097673b431ae561ffb  
17:47 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: I'm listing all the issues I find. I leave it to you to organize them to not forget them, ok? :)  
17:48 <vmassol> my goal now is to test the max stuff  
17:48 <vmassol> regarding top active members, my user has an apostrophe in its name  
17:50 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: Ok, I will check on monday by using the IRC logs  
17:50 <vmassol> hmm it would be nice to fix the delete so that marius can release  
17:50 <vmassol> not sure when marius wants to release though  
17:51 <vmassol> we lost 2 more days so far, not nice  
17:55 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: also, is it normal that there's no Scheduler jobs in new wiki?  
17:57 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:58 <gdelhumeau> you have installed from the DW?  
17:59 <camil7> has quit  
17:59 <vmassol> yes  
18:02 <gdelhumeau> then it's strange  
18:11 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:17 <gdelhumeau> vmassol: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/pull/205  
18:18 <gdelhumeau> I know this is not enought, I should modify something on DefaultWikiDescriptorCache#remove() or maybe in WikiDescriptorListener too  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> But at least there is no exception  
18:19 <gdelhumeau> and I have to go  
18:23 <gdelhumeau> well it seems there is other exceptions related to solr on deleted wikis  
18:23 <gdelhumeau> I really have to go :/
